episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of intriguing topics, including Charles Darwin's unusual pet bug, the real-life inspiration behind "The Exorcist" who became a NASA engineer, plants' ability to remember droughts, and a house party so boozy it affected a breathalyzer test. The hosts delve into these facts with their usual mix of humor and curiosity.

facts.fact: Charles Darwin kept a pet bug so he could see how long it lasted on a meal of blood.
The child who the book The Exorcist was based on went on to become a NASA engineer whose inventions contributed to the Apollo moon missions.
Plants remember droughts and they like it.
In 2017, there was a house party in Maryland that was so boozy the ambient air in the building tested positive on a breathalyzer.
